title: Eddie Nketiah hoping hat-trick for England U21s will make Marcelo Bielsa sit up and take notice after frustrating start to Leeds loan
text:
Eddie Nketiah hopes that his hat-trick for England under-21s will convince Marcelo Bielsa to give him more minutes at Leeds United after a frustrating start to his loan spell at Elland Road.

Nketiah has been in prolific form this season and is the joint-top scorer at Leeds despite only starting two matches this campaign, both in the League Cup. He struck with three poacher’s finishes for England against Austria on Tuesday night and was denied a fourth when his late penalty was saved.

The on-loan Arsenal striker has scored 10 goals in 13 appearances for club and country this season and is averaging a goal every 63 minutes of action, but has been frustrated by his lack of opportunities under Bielsa so far.

“It has been disappointing for me not to start in the league,” said Nketiah. “I went there to play games and get games. It is still early times. I think every time I have come on I have done well and shown why I think I should be playing.

“I think [the hat-trick against Austria] was a good statement and a good way for me to put across a performance. Hopefully I will be starting in the next run of games.”
description: Eddie Nketiah hopes that his hat-trick for England under-21s will convince Marcelo Bielsa to give him more minutes at Leeds United after a frustrating start to his loan spell at Elland Road.
